#Text=Resolve Apartment Issues
#Text=Living with strangers , or even friends , can be challenging – especially if it 's your first time living away from home .
#Text=Learn how to divide the bills and chores in a winning style .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Compromise on the bedrooms .
#Text=It 's rare that apartments have rooms of equal size .
#Text=As a result , some people might feel they 've got the short end of the stick when they do n't end up with the master bedroom .
#Text=However , there is a happy solution for helping roommates opt for smaller or less attractive rooms – make them cheaper .
#Text=You know what you 're collectively expected to pay for monthly rent , but how you divide this cost is up to you .
#Text=People with larger bedrooms pay more ; people with smaller bedrooms pay less .
#Text=Usually this works out because there is always somebody who has more possessions to accommodate in the apartment and somebody else who is trying to save money .
#Text=Divide up the bills evenly .
#Text=This is the most important , and divisive , issue in every apartment – who pays for what and when .
#Text=There are several strategies to handle the apartment bills .
#Text=All roommates could take responsibility by having a bill in their name so each person receives a bill , rather than all bills being directed to just one person .
#Text=This avoids the risk of one roommate being left to pay out of their own pocket if others miss payments or leave the apartment .
#Text=Setting up automatic payments for each individual 's monthly expenses takes the hassle out of remembering or encouraging your roommates to pay on time .
#Text=Another solution is to open an apartment bank account , which everybody automatically pays into each week to cover bills and expenses , including food .
#Text=Set up a day every month , perhaps the last Sunday , to reconcile your bills and issues so you can feel confident that the rent and bills will be paid on time .
#Text=Divvy up the duties .
#Text=Nobody likes doing the dishes or taking out the garbage , but it needs to be done .
#Text=Have a duties roster with clearly assigned roles for each day .
#Text=Your roommates will learn to get into the groove of doing chores and will understand that everyone must pull their weight .
#Text=Dishes can be a subject of contention .
#Text=Make it clear whether people are responsible for just their own dishes , or if they are all assigned particular dish days .
#Text=Make sure everyone is comfortable .
#Text=Maybe one roommate likes listening to heavy metal , one is a TV addict and another likes to smoke .
#Text=It 's important to find the balance between enjoying your interests and hobbies and respecting others ' rights not to share in these .
#Text=Smokers should smoke outside , especially if your apartment is smoke-free .
#Text=Your music should not interfere with your roommates , unless by agreement .
#Text=Do n't let any one person dominate the TV .
#Text=If the TV is a concern for you , buy or borrow an additional TV for your room .
#Text=Respecting each other 's privacy and comfort , and taking the time to get to know each other , will go a long way towards creating a harmonious apartment environment .
